definition: to refund money
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
surname Qian

sentences.english: To solve these problems, I would like to return the printer and get a refund.
sentences.chinese: 爲了解決這些問題，我打算把貨退還並要求退錢。

sentences.english: Efficient quality control should significantly reduce the amount of merchandise that is taken back for refund.
sentences.chinese: 有效的品管應該可以顯著地減少要求退錢的商品數量。

sentences.english: Mom suggested that I should get a refund on the air-conditioner right away.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽建議我趕緊把這臺冷氣拿去退錢。

sentences.english: Salesperson:Could I have a refund on this?
sentences.chinese: 我這個東西可以退錢嗎？

sentences.english: The service here is terrible. I demand a refund.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的服務太差了，我要求退錢。

sentences.english: Hundreds of Chinese tourists streamed toward the front gate demanding their money back.
sentences.chinese: 數百名中國遊客衝到大門前，要求退錢。

sentences.english: Please bring it back in and we will give you a refund or replace it.
sentences.chinese: 請把它拿過來，我們會退錢或是換一個給你。

sentences.english: Do you give refunds on empties ?
Please send me the correct books as soon as possible or give my money back instead.
sentences.chinese: 請儘快將正確的書寄給本人或是退錢給本人。

sentences.english: May I return it to get my money back?
I won't buy their air-conditioner if they hadn't guaranteed a refund.
sentences.chinese: 如果當初沒有退錢保證，我不會買那臺冷氣機。

definition: to place an order (commerce)
see 賒賬|赊账[she1 zhang4]
to be in arrears/to be out of credit/amount owing
to undercut competitors/to hustle/to compete for business
day laborer/temporary work
IOU/informal document acknowledging a debt
lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
cannot afford/cannot bear the burden
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to comparison shop (idiom)/comparison shopping
debt of gratitude
to bill/to open a tab
to replace a purchase/to exchange a purchase
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
